unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate the ability to implement teaching strategies to expand learning opportunities and use a variety of resources, including technology-based, to plan, implement and manage a range of learning environments.
Show a developing understanding of pedagogy and appropriate teaching strategies for quality literacy and numeracy learning experiences and be able to critically reflect on these.
Demonstrate a developing knowledge of content, the structural organisation and scope and sequence of curriculum content, as prescribed by the NSW syllabus documents for Mathematics and English.
Demonstrate the ability to design and implement lessons in Mathematics and English that are engaging and motivating for K-6 students and are linked to appropriate learning outcomes.

enrolment_rules.description: (80cp at 1000 level or above) including (EDUC107 or EDUC1070) or ((EDUC105 or EDUC1050) and (EDUC106 or EDUC1060))

assessments.description: In this assignment you will design a lesson focusing on a text you have selected from recommended sources (about 1500 words).
Examination. It will include 2 papers: one on English and one on Mathematics.
This assignment will focus on a Math teaching task, as well as the design of resources to support the teaching of the task (about 1500 words).

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, Other
data.subject_search_title: EDTE2510 - Curriculum and Teaching in the Primary School 1
data.description: This is the first in a sequence of six primary curriculum units and provides an introduction to primary teaching. The lectures and workshops focus on the syllabus structure, content and skills of the key learning areas of English and Mathematics, and the development of knowledge of their associated pedagogical strategies. Students have the opportunity to apply this knowledge during their participation in a school experience program.
